tier.item: (9) Le máak-o', túun kach-ik le che'
YUK DEF person-D2 PROG:A.3 break-INC(B.3.SG) DEF tree
káa h k'uch-en-o'. U k'áat y-a'l-e':
káa PRV arrive-B.1.SG-D2 A.3 wish(B.3.SG) A.3-say(B.3.SG)-TOP
`The man, he was breaking the tree (when) I arrived. This means he had begun to break
it, but he had not yet broken it entirely.'

dinner, between seven and eight, and then he went to bed.' (Proga 72)

`APedro, (on) Monday he sent a letter to Pablo. B(On) Thursday, Juan asked Pedro:
"Did you already send the letter?" DPedro answered: E"I sent it long ago, but I forgot
exactly what day I sent it."' (Bohnemeyer 1998a: 408)

Pedro-e' lùunes-ak káa t-u túucht-ah hun-p'éel kàarta ti' Pablo. Hwèebes-ak káa t-u k'áat-ah uy u'b-ah Juan ti' Pedro-e': "Ts'o'k a túucht-ik le kàarta-o'?" DKáa t-u núuk-ah Pedro-e', "Úuch in túucht-eh, chéen ba'l-e' h tu'b tèen hach ba'x k'ìin-ak káa t-in túucht-ah."

APedro, (on) Monday he sent a letter to Pablo. B(On) Thursday, Juan asked Pedro: "Did you already send the letter?"DPedro answered: E"I sent it long ago, but I forgot exactly what day I sent it."
`On Monday, it was long ago that I sent it.' (Bohnemeyer 1998a: 408)
`On Monday, it was long ago that I sent it.' (Bohnemeyer 1998a: 408)
On Monday, it was long ago that I sent it.
LEZ a. Gah=gah lak'rab insan req'i-daldi ada-l alamuq'-zawa.
`Sometimes a nickname remains on a person until s/he dies.'

b. Mizafer.a ñawab gu-daldi Ajnise raxa-na:....
a. -A: Te ha llamado Pablo. Está en casa. Llámalo.
you(OBL) has(PRS) called(PTC) Pablo he is(PRS) at home call(IMP) him
`You got a phone call from Pablo. He's at home. Call him.'
a. -A: Te ha llamado Pablo. Está en casa. Llámalo.
you(OBL) has(PRS) called(PTC) Pablo he is(PRS) at home call(IMP) him

you(OBL) has(PRS) called(PTC) Pablo he is(PRS) at home call(IMP) him

-A: No sé. A mí me dijo que estaba en casa.
not I know(PRS) to me(TOP) me(OBL) he said(PRT) that he was(IMPERF) at home
`I dunno. He told me he was at home.'
-A: No sé. A mí me dijo que estaba en casa.
not I know(PRS) to me(TOP) me(OBL) he said(PRT) that he was(IMPERF) at home
`I dunno. He told me he was at home.'

not I know(PRS) to me(TOP) me(OBL) he said(PRT) that he was(IMPERF) at home

tier.item: b. Acabo de hablar con Luis. Me ha dicho
I just talked with Luis me(OBL) he has(PRS) said(PTC)
que mañana no podrá venir a la reunión.
that tomorrow not he will be able(FUT) come(INF) to the meeting
`I just talked to Luis. He told me he won't be able to come to the meeting tomorrow.'

I just talked with Luis me(OBL) he has(PRS) said(PTC)
que mañana no podrá venir a la reunión.
that tomorrow not he will be able(FUT) come(INF) to the meeting

I just talked with Luis me(OBL) he has(PRS) said(PTC) that tomorrow not he will be able(FUT) come(INF) to the meeting
I just talked to Luis. He told me he won't be able to come to the meeting tomorrow.
c. - A: Estás seguro de que va a venir?
you are(PRS) certain of that he goes(PRS) to come(INF)
`Are you sure that he's going to come?'
c. - A: Estás seguro de que va a venir?
you are(PRS) certain of that he goes(PRS) to come(INF)
`Are you sure that he's going to come?'
-A: Estás seguro de que va a venir?
you are(PRS) certain of that he goes(PRS) to come(INF)
Are you sure that he's going to come?
- B: No sé. Ayer me dijo que vendría.
not I know(PRS) yesterday me(OBL) he said(PRT) that he would come(COND)
`I dunno. He told me yesterday he'd come.' (Matte Bon 1992: 323-324)
